'''''Pawn Stars''''' is an American [[reality television series]] on the [[History (TV channel)|History Channel]], produced in [[Manhattan]] by Leftfield Pictures. The series is filmed in [[Las Vegas, Nevada]], where it chronicles the daily activities at the Gold & Silver [[Pawn Shop]], a 24-hour [[family business]] operated by patriarch Richard Harrison (or "The Old Man"), his son Rick Harrison (who opened the shop with his father in 1988), Rick's son Corey (who has worked there since childhood), and Corey's childhood friend, Austin "Chumlee" Russell. The show, which rose to become the network's highest rated show,<ref name=CNNMoney>Childers, Linda. [http://money.cnn.com/2011/07/06/smallbusiness/rick_harrison/ "Rick Harrison of 'Pawn Stars' spills success secrets"], [[CNN Money]], July 7, 2011</ref><ref>[http://www.lasvegassun.com/news/2010/feb/26/corey-harrison/ "Corey Harrison: Partner and general manager, Gold and Silver Pawn"], ''[[Las Vegas Sun]]'', February 26, 2010</ref> and the No. 2 reality show behind ''[[Jersey Shore (TV series)|Jersey Shore]]'', debuted on July 26, 2009, and it usually airs on Mondays at 10pm [[Eastern Time Zone|Eastern Time]]. Two new episodes usually premiere in an hour block on Mondays.<ref name="history.com">[http://www.history.com/content/pawn-stars/episode-guide Episode guide], at History.com, accessed May 9, 2011.</ref><ref>The 26th through 29th episodes of the second season were each aired once a week. "Zzzzzz" and "The British Are Coming", the 30th and 31st episodes of the second season, aired Sunday, April 25, 2010.</ref> Reruns can be seen on History as well as its sister network [[Lifetime (TV channel)|Lifetime]], which added the show in December 2010.<ref>[http://www.locatetv.com/tv/pawn-stars/6388433 ''Pawn Stars''], Locate TV, accessed December 23, 2010.</ref><ref>Rick Harrison and Tim Keown. ''License to Pawn,'' [http://www.google.com/search?tbm=bks&tbo=1&q=%22have+dinner+with+us%2C+Chumlee%22&btnG=Search+Books 204].</ref>
+
'''''Pawn Stars''''' is an American [[reality television series]] on the [[History (TV channel)|History Channel]], produced in [[Manhattan]] by Leftfield Pictures. The series is filmed in [[Las Vegas, Nevada]], where it chronicles the daily activities at the Gold & Silver [[Pawn Shop]], a 24-hour [[family business]] operated by patriarch Richard Harrison (or "The Old Man"), his son Rick Harrison (who opened the shop with his father in 1988), Rick's son Corey (who has worked there since childhood), and Corey's childhood friend, Austin "Chumlee" Russell. The show, which rose to become the network's highest rated show,<ref name=CNNMoney>Childers, Linda. [http://money.cnn.com/2011/07/06/smallbusiness/rick_harrison/ "Rick Harrison of 'Pawn Stars' spills success secrets"], [[CNN Money]], July 7, 2011</ref><ref>[http://www.lasvegassun.com/news/2010/feb/26/corey-harrison/ "Corey Harrison: Partner and general manager, Gold and Silver Pawn"], ''[[Las Vegas Sun]]'', February 26, 2010</ref> and the No. 2 reality show behind ''[[Jersey Shore (TV series)|Jersey Shore]]'', debuted on July 26, 2009. Reruns can be seen on History as well as its sister network [[Lifetime (TV channel)|Lifetime]], which added the show in December 2010.<ref>[http://www.locatetv.com/tv/pawn-stars/6388433 ''Pawn Stars''], Locate TV, accessed December 23, 2010.</ref><ref>Rick Harrison and Tim Keown. ''License to Pawn,'' [http://www.google.com/search?tbm=bks&tbo=1&q=%22have+dinner+with+us%2C+Chumlee%22&btnG=Search+Books 204].</ref>
The series depicts the staff's interactions with customers, who bring in a variety of artifacts to sell or pawn and who are shown haggling over the price and discussing its historical background, with narration provided by Rick, Corey, Richard (who is known as "The Old Man"), and occasionally Chumlee. The series also follows the [[interpersonal relationship|interpersonal conflicts]] between Richard, Rick, Corey, and Chumlee. One reviewer referencing these conflicts described the show as a version of ''[[Antiques Roadshow]]'' "hijacked by ''[[American Chopper]]'''s" Teutul family.<ref>[http://www.lvrj.com/living/51132932.html Lawrence, Christopher. "Las Vegas pawnshop center of new reality series"] ''[[Las Vegas Review-Journal]]''; July 19, 2009</ref> ''[[TV Guide]]'' has offered a similar description, calling the show "one part ''Antiques Roadshow'', a pinch of ''[[LA Ink]]'' and a dash of ''[[COPS (TV series)|COPS]]''".<ref name=TVGuide>Moynihan, Rob. "Summer's Guilty Pleasures" ''[[TV Guide]]''; June 21, 2010; Page 23</ref>

The series also follows the [[interpersonal relationship|interpersonal conflicts]] between Richard, Rick, Corey, and Chumlee. One reviewer referencing these conflicts described the show as a version of ''[[Antiques Roadshow]]'' "hijacked by ''[[American Chopper]]'''s" Teutul family.<ref>[http://www.lvrj.com/living/51132932.html Lawrence, Christopher. "Las Vegas pawnshop center of new reality series"] ''[[Las Vegas Review-Journal]]''; July 19, 2009</ref> ''[[TV Guide]]'' has offered a similar description, calling the show "one part ''Antiques Roadshow'', a pinch of ''[[LA Ink]]'' and a dash of ''[[COPS (TV series)|COPS]]''".<ref name=TVGuide>Moynihan, Rob. "Summer's Guilty Pleasures" ''[[TV Guide]]''; June 21, 2010; Page 23</ref>
